description:
A sci-fi roguelike deckbuilder with a deep new single-axis spin on tactics games! Dodge missiles,
line up your cannons, and blast 'em out of the sky... Then get to the bottom of these time loops,
before it's too late!

release/1.0.0.description:
First public release!
Everything should be working alright but since I was the only tester up until now, I've probably missed some stuff. Feedback and bug reports are welcome! Please consult the [README](https://github.com/Isaac-SOL/CobaltCoreArchipelagoMod/blob/master/README.md) for more info.

release/1.0.1.description:
A few fixes for issues that players have found.

- Shuffling memories should no longer crash when generating a world
- Additional text for AP card upgrades has been made more consistent
- Fixed character and ship unlock tooltips being wrong or buggy
- Starting a new file now doesn't start a run immediately
- Cards now recheck whether they are unlocked whenever they are drawn
- The mod should now be compatible with CombatQoL future vision & undo (or lack thereof)

Many thanks to the people who have reported these issues! Please keep notifying me of any bugs. As I said before, content mods are explicitly not supported at the moment, but I will keep trying to make AP compatible with other kind of mods.

release/1.0.2.description:
- Fixed an issue that prevented players from receiving memories when they are shuffled

The APWorld is unchanged in this release (same as version 1.0.1)
The YAML settings are unchanged in this release (same as version 1.0.1)

release/1.1.0.description:
Full release for the already-existing unstable versions.

The APWorld and YAML files are the same as the pre-release versions.

## New features for this stable version

- CAT summons now always contain a playable card

## New features (already present in unstable versions)

- Added new Deathlink modes: Missing! and Hull Damage. These are softer options to play on multiworlds with relatively frequent deathlinks, so that they don't end your run immediately.
- Added some soft logic to avoid having too many items accessible right from the start, which could cause issues with progression balancing.
  - This is in preparation for a bigger progression/logic overhaul that will happen in 1.2.0.
- Added an input textbox in the main menu to send commands to the Archipelago host. This allows you to communicate with other players as well as use hints, among other things.
- Added the `unlock_memory_for_all_characters` yaml setting, which will allow you to unlock one memory for each of your currently selected characters at the end of a run. This should make the game more viable for synced games!
  - Also added an indicator for how many memories have been unlocked per character at the end, in case you want to play with that setting off.
- Removed the `minimum_difficulty` yaml setting, as I feel it was mostly useless anyway. Minimum difficulty is up to you during gameplay!
- A new boot option will always appear at the beginning of a run to pick one unlocked card to add to your deck.
  - A similar boot option will be added in the future for artifacts.
- Cleo's shop now has a new option to add one archipelago item card to your deck among all the ones that you have seen in rewards, but not used, with your current characters.
  - A similar option will be added in the future for archipelago item artifacts.
- Rewards in events the only give you a single random card should now always give you an unlocked card, provided that `get_more_found_items` is set to `true`.
- Added support for the generic `start_inventory_from_pool` setting. Items removed from the pool this way will be replaced with filler items giving you energy or temp shields during fights.

## Fixes (already present in unstable versions)

- It should no longer be possible to receive artifacts for ships that you aren't currently using from archipelago, or other artifacts that can only be obtained in specific conditions if these conditions aren't met.
- The connection screen will now check that the slot data received is correct and prevent connecting if it is not, to catch version mismatches between the APWorld and the mod.
- You should no longer see notifications for ship and characters you haven't actually unlocked at the end of a run.
- Improved compatibility with CombatQoL.

release/1.1.0-rc1.description:
A few new features and overhauled some existing features based on feedback.

As always, big thanks to everyone playing with the mod and giving feedback. While the mod seems to be stable enough, progression balancing is still a work in progress, so these discussions are very helpful in figuring out how to make the experience more fun.

Also, the mod is now also available on [NexusMods](https://www.nexusmods.com/cobaltcore/mods/81)!

## New features

- Added new Deathlink modes: Missing! and Hull Damage. These are softer options to play on multiworlds with relatively frequent deathlinks, so that they don't end your run immediately.
- Added some soft logic to avoid having too many items accessible right from the start, which could cause issues with progression balancing.
  - This is in preparation for a bigger progression/logic overhaul that will happen in 1.2.0.
- Added an input textbox in the main menu to send commands to the Archipelago host. This allows you to communicate with other players as well as use hints, among other things.
- Added the `unlock_memory_for_all_characters` yaml setting, which will allow you to unlock one memory for each of your currently selected characters at the end of a run. This should make the game more viable for synced games!
  - Also added an indicator for how many memories have been unlocked per character at the end, in case you want to play with that setting off.
- Removed the `minimum_difficulty` yaml setting, as I feel it was mostly useless anyway. Minimum difficulty is up to you during gameplay!
- A new boot option will always appear at the beginning of a run to pick one unlocked card to add to your deck.
  - A similar boot option will be added in the future for artifacts.
- Cleo's shop now has a new option to add one archipelago item card to your deck among all the ones that you have seen in rewards, but not used, with your current characters.
  - A similar option will be added in the future for archipelago item artifacts.
- Rewards in events the only give you a single random card should now always give you an unlocked card, provided that `get_more_found_items` is set to `true`.
- Added support for the generic `start_inventory_from_pool` setting. Items removed from the pool this way will be replaced with filler items giving you energy or temp shields during fights.

## Fixes

- It should no longer be possible to receive artifacts for ships that you aren't currently using from archipelago, or other artifacts that can only be obtained in specific conditions if these conditions aren't met.
- The connection screen will now check that the slot data received is correct and prevent connecting if it is not, to catch version mismatches between the APWorld and the mod.
- You should no longer see notifications for ship and characters you haven't actually unlocked at the end of a run.
- Improved compatibility with CombatQoL.
release/1.1.0-rc1.title: 1.1.0-rc1

release/1.1.0-rc2.description:
- Added NexusMods update checks
- Fixed crash when card or artifact rewards were set to `if_has_deck` or `if_local_and_has_deck`
- Fixed crash that would sometimes happen with AP cards that would unlock artifacts

The APworld and YAML files are identical to 1.1.0-rc1.
release/1.1.0-rc2.title: 1.1.0-rc2

release/1.1.1.description:
A few tweaks here and there to make the experience better

- "Pick an unlocked card" boot option and "pick a missed archipelago card" at shops can now be canceled
- You will no longer receive AP item cards that you already have in your deck
- If you're out of combat and you receive an item or deathlink that can only be applied while in combat (such as the missing deathlink), it will now be applied at the start of the next combat
- A certain card scales faster now

The APworld and YAML files are unchanged (same as 1.1.0)

release/1.1.2.description:
Fixes for a couple of minor, but annoying, bugs

- Guarantee a heat-generating starting card for Drake
- Fixed a bug where the characters would start with no offensive cards
- Hopefully fixed a bug that would sometimes cause a death on the first loop

The APworld must be updated.
The YAML settings are unchanged (same as 1.1.0)

release/1.1.4.description:
- Fixed cards being unplayable when `shuffle_cards` is set to `false`

The YAML and APworld are unchanged in this release (same as 1.1.3)

release/1.1.5.description:
- `shuffle_artifacts` now has a `double` setting, which is the new default. With this setting, almost all AP artifacts give two AP items instead of one, to compensate for the amount of artifacts to artifact offerings ratio. You can still get one item per artifact with the `simple` setting.
- AP artifacts now show which items they give and the recipient's names on the button itself.
- The codex has been revamped.
  - All cards and artifacts are now unlocked in the codex from the start, with extra visuals to show which ones have been actually unlocked in AP or not
  - Added the "Archipelago Tracker" page in the codex. It shows you which items you can access, which ones you've gotten, and which ones have been hinted.
- Added the `auto_release_characters` option (off by default). With it, you can set an amount of run completions required for a character to automatically release all their associated items, so that you never need to run with them again. Be careful though, some of these items may be traps!
- The mod now checks more accurately for the APworld version when connecting, and should give a more precise error in the log in case of version mismatches in the future.
- Hovering over character portraits anywhere will now show you the amount of memories (or memory items in case of `shuffle_memories`) that you've found with them in the tooltip, including during a run.

The YAML and APWorld must both be updated.

As always, thanks everyone for the feedback! While there are some more minor features I want to add, I think I'll bundle them with 1.2.0 and the progression smoothing, which means that barring any significant bugs, this should be the last version before 1.2.0.
